questions.question: If <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Add 8 to both sides: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. Divide by 5: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To solve linear equations, isolate the variable by performing inverse operations step by step.

questions.question: The equation of a line is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. What is the y-intercept of the line?
questions.explanation: The y-intercept is the constant term in the slope-intercept form <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, which is 4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember that in the slope-intercept form, b represents the y-intercept.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='190' y='295' font-size='12'>Time (seconds)</text><text x='0' y='150' font-size='12' transform='rotate(-90 0 150)'>Height (feet)</text><path d='M40 280 Q200 20 360 280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' fill='none' /><text x='30' y='295' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='360' y='295' font-size='12'>4</text><text x='5' y='285' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='5' y='25' font-size='12'>40</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A parabolic graph opening downward, representing the height of a ball over time.
questions.question: The graph shows the height, in feet, of a ball thrown upward as a function of time, in seconds. What is the best interpretation of the vertex of the graph in this context?

options.A: The initial height of the ball
options.B: The maximum height the ball reaches
options.C: The time when the ball hits the ground

questions.explanation: The vertex of a downward-opening parabola represents the maximum point, which in this context is the highest height the ball attains.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='190' y='295' font-size='12'>Time (seconds)</text><text x='0' y='150' font-size='12' transform='rotate(-90 0 150)'>Height (feet)</text><path d='M40 280 Q200 20 360 280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' fill='none' /><circle cx='200' cy='20' r='5' fill='red' /><text x='210' y='30' font-size='12' fill='red'>Vertex (maximum height)</text><text x='30' y='295' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='360' y='295' font-size='12'>4</text><text x='5' y='285' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='5' y='25' font-size='12'>40</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: The parabola with the vertex highlighted in red, indicating the maximum height.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In quadratic functions representing real-world scenarios, identify what the vertex signifies based on the context.

questions.question: A shirt costs $40. If it is on sale for 25% off, what is the sale price? Enter your answer as a decimal.
questions.explanation: 25% of 40 is 10. Subtract: 40 - 10 = 30.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find a percentage discount, calculate the discount amount and subtract from the original price.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question: What is the solution to the system of equations <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Add the equations: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>, so <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Substitute into first: <math><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use elimination method by adding or subtracting equations to solve systems of linear equations.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mn>1.05</mn><mi>t</mi></msup></math> models the value, in dollars, of an investment after <math><mi>t</mi></math> years. What does the number 1.05 represent in this context?

options.A: The initial value of the investment
options.B: The annual growth rate as a decimal
options.D: The total value after t years

questions.explanation: In the exponential growth model <math><mi>P</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi><mo>)</mo><msup></msup><mi>t</mi></math>, r is the growth rate, so 0.05 is 5%, and 1.05 is 1 + r.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In exponential functions, identify the base as 1 plus the growth rate for growth models.

questions.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>?
questions.explanation: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, so <math><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Factor numerator and denominator to simplify rational expressions.

questions.question: The radius of a circle is 6. What is the area of the circle? Use <math><mi>π</mi><mo>≈</mo><mn>3.14</mn></math> and round to the nearest integer.
questions.explanation: Area = <math><mi>π</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>3.14</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>36</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>113.04</mn></math>, rounded to 113.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember the formula for the area of a circle is πr² and use approximation for π when specified.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: If 4 apples cost $2, how much do 10 apples cost?
questions.explanation: Unit price = 2/4 = 0.5 per apple. For 10: 10 × 0.5 = 5.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Find the unit rate to solve proportional relationship problems.

questions.question: Solve <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. What are the solutions?
questions.explanation: Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, so x=2 or x=3.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Factor quadratic equations to find roots when possible.

questions.question: The product of two positive integers is 900. If the first integer is 4 times the second integer, what is the smaller integer?
questions.explanation: Let the smaller be y, then the larger is 4y, and 4y * y = 900. So 4y² = 900, y² = 225, y = 15 (since positive).
questions.score_improvement_tip: Set up equations for word problems involving integer constraints and solve for the unknown.

questions.question: Which of the following is the solution to the inequality <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>></mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Subtract 2x: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Subtract 6: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. Divide by 3, reverse inequality: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi></math>? Wait, -9 > 3x, divide by 3 (positive), -3 > x, or x < -3.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When solving inequalities, remember to reverse the inequality sign when multiplying or dividing by a negative number.

questions.question: The equation <math><mi>x</mi><mo>^</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>^</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math> represents a circle, and the equation <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></math> represents a line. What is the y-coordinate of the point of intersection with the smaller y-value? Enter as a decimal if necessary.
questions.explanation: Substitute y = 2x - 5 into x² + y² = 25: x² + (2x - 5)² = 25 → x² + 4x² -20x +25 =25 →5x² -20x =0 →5x(x-4)=0 →x=0 or x=4. For x=0, y= -5, but check: 0 +25 =25, yes. For x=4, y=8-5=3, 16+9=25. Smaller y is -5
questions.score_improvement_tip: Substitute the linear equation into the quadratic to solve systems involving nonlinear equations.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='40' y='265' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='40' y='45' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='355' y='265' font-size='12'>C</text><text x='200' y='200' font-size='12'>30°</text><text x='80' y='80' font-size='12'>12</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Right triangle ABC with right angle at A, angle at C is 30 degrees, side AB is 12.
questions.question: In the right triangle shown, what is the length of side AC?
questions.explanation: In a 30-60-90 triangle, the side opposite 30° is half the hypotenuse. Here, hypotenuse is BC, no, right at A, angle at C 30°, so angle at B 60°. Side opposite to 30° is AB =12, wait, AB is from A to B, which is one leg, the vertical. If right at A, side opposite to C is AB. Angle at C is 30°, opposite is AB =12, hypotenuse is BC. So opposite 30° is 12, hypotenuse =2*12=24, then other leg AC =12√3. Yes, B is 6√3? Wait, no, opposite 30° is half hypotenuse, so 12 = half, hypotenuse 24, then leg AC = hypotenuse * (√3/2) =24*(√3/2)=12√3. So answer D.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='50' x2='350' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='40' y='265' font-size='12'>A</text><text x='40' y='45' font-size='12'>B</text><text x='355' y='265' font-size='12'>C</text><text x='200' y='200' font-size='12'>30°</text><text x='80' y='80' font-size='12'>12</text><text x='50' y='160' font-size='12' fill='blue'>60°</text><text x='200' y='265' font-size='12' fill='red'>12√3</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Right triangle with angles labeled and side AC highlighted.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize the side ratios for 30-60-90 triangles: 1 : √3 : 2.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' /><text x='190' y='295' font-size='12'>Hours Studied</text><text x='0' y='150' font-size='12' transform='rotate(-90 0 150)'>Test Score</text><circle cx='40' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='100' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='160' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='220' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='280' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='30' y1='260' x2='290' y2='40' stroke='red' stroke-dasharray='5,5' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Scatterplot showing positive correlation between hours studied and test score.
questions.question: The scatterplot shows test scores as a function of hours studied. Which of the following best describes the relationship?
questions.explanation: The points show an increasing trend, indicating a positive linear relationship.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' /><text x='190' y='295' font-size='12'>Hours Studied</text><text x='0' y='150' font-size='12' transform='rotate(-90 0 150)'>Test Score</text><circle cx='40' cy='250' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='100' cy='200' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='160' cy='150' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='220' cy='100' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='280' cy='50' r='3' fill='black' /><line x1='30' y1='260' x2='290' y2='40' stroke='red' /><text x='300' y='50' font-size='12' fill='red'>Line of best fit</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: Scatterplot with line of best fit added in red.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Look for the overall trend in scatterplots to determine the type of correlation.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='190' y='295' font-size='12'>Time (years)</text><text x='0' y='150' font-size='12' transform='rotate(-90 0 150)'>Population</text><path d='M40 280 L80 240 L120 210 L160 185 L200 165 L240 150 L280 140 L320 132 L360 126' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' fill='none' /><text x='30' y='295' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='360' y='295' font-size='12'>8</text><text x='5' y='285' font-size='12'>1000</text><text x='5' y='25' font-size='12'>5000</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A decreasing curve approaching a horizontal asymptote, representing population decline.
questions.question: The graph shows the population of a species as a function of time. What is the best interpretation of the horizontal asymptote in this context?

options.B: The minimum population the species can reach

questions.explanation: The horizontal asymptote represents the value the function approaches but never reaches, here the lowest population level.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='190' y='295' font-size='12'>Time (years)</text><text x='0' y='150' font-size='12' transform='rotate(-90 0 150)'>Population</text><path d='M40 280 L80 240 L120 210 L160 185 L200 165 L240 150 L280 140 L320 132 L360 126' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' fill='none' /><line x1='20' y1='120' x2='380' y2='120' stroke='red' stroke-dasharray='5,5' /><text x='300' y='115' font-size='12' fill='red'>Asymptote</text><text x='30' y='295' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='360' y='295' font-size='12'>8</text><text x='5' y='285' font-size='12'>1000</text><text x='5' y='25' font-size='12'>5000</text></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: The curve with the horizontal asymptote highlighted in red.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In graphs of rational or exponential decay functions, the asymptote indicates limiting behavior.

questions.question: The equation of a circle is <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><msup><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><msup><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. What is the radius of the circle?
questions.explanation: The standard form is <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo><msup><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo><msup><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, so r² = 16, r = 4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Identify the radius as the square root of the constant term in the standard circle equation.

questions.question: A bag contains 3 red balls and 7 blue balls. If two balls are drawn without replacement, what is the probability that both are red?
questions.explanation: Probability first red: 3/10, second red: 2/9. Multiply: (3/10)*(2/9) = 6/90 = 1/15.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For without replacement, adjust the total and favorable after each draw.

questions.question: Solve <math><msqrt><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math> for <math><mi>x</mi></math>.
questions.explanation: Isolate square root: <math><msqrt><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Square both sides: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>. Subtract 4: <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>32</mn></math>. Check: <math><msqrt><mn>36</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>, yes.
questions.score_improvement_tip: After solving radical equations, check solutions in the original equation to avoid extraneous roots.

questions.question: The inequality <math><mn>−</mn><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></math> is equivalent to which of the following?
questions.explanation: Distribute: <math><mn>−</mn><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></math>. Add 2x: <math><mn>6</mn><mo>≤</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>. Subtract 4: <math><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi></math>, or <math><mi>x</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Carefully distribute negative signs and remember to reverse inequalities only when multiplying/dividing by negatives.
